title: MozFest - Sticky Newsletter CTA blocks users from coninuting with ticket purchase
body:
### Describe the bug
(Submitted via [Slack](https://mozilla.slack.com/archives/C98GW3P7X/p1678295136964469))

> Hello! We made some changes to the ticketing flow for MozFest, as we were seeing higher than usual drop offs between 'Adding to Basket' and 'Purchase' - thanks to GA4 work we're finally able to see!
The changes have caused the modal to extend down - now on pages where there is also a newsletter sign up the sticky 'Sign Up' CTA button is blocking being able to press continue on the flow when using mobile.
We've removed the newsletter sign up from the homepage as an immediate fix, but would it be possible to disable (or have a toggle) for having the sticky CTA for newsletter sign ups.
Example is here:
https://www.mozillafestival.org/newsletter


### To Reproduce
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to https://www.mozillafestival.org/newsletter on smaller screen / mobile
2. Click on "secure your ticket" from nav
3. Click through the screens in Tito popup
4. See error

### Expected behavior
No elements should block Tito popup

### Screenshots
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2896608/223788043-ea00666e-bde2-4ae0-aed2-b4c1d946254c.png)

title: SPIKE - Percy is not failing PR checks when visual changes are detected

labels.name: maintain
labels.description: Maintain digital systems

body:
It seems like Percy is not reporting visual regressions correctly on the PRs! 

E.g. on [this PR](https://github.com/MozillaFoundation/foundation.mozilla.org/pull/10258), the check is shown as passed: 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/24797493/223154897-bf007c85-6677-40ce-b477-bdb3f14caeab.png)

The CLI says it passed: https://github.com/MozillaFoundation/foundation.mozilla.org/actions/runs/4328210848/jobs/7557657111#step:11:2496

But the Percy dashboard shows changes that should be reviewed: https://percy.io/Mozilla-Foundation/foundation.mozilla.org/builds/25657087/changed/1430697617?browser=chrome&browser_ids=33%2C34&subcategories=unreviewed%2Cchanges_requested&viewLayout=side-by-side&viewMode=new&width=1280&widths=375%2C1280

In fact, all our recent runs are unreviewed in the Percy dashboard 😳
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/24797493/223154747-26895b99-eeda-468c-95a4-d8c8a5501779.png)

title: SPIKE | User Account settings don't appear in the Wagtail dashboard
body:
For some reason, we don't have the ability to set things like time zones in our account views:

![nosettings](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/41487159/218824976-95a160ee-2582-4894-9511-ef2f16808bb1.jpg)

@bheasman sent a video of the settings that are typically available from this view.

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/41487159/218824809-e403561d-2670-4f9b-8134-00dd6da98b00.mov


One theory is that the SSO plugin we're using (found [here](https://github.com/python-social-auth/social-app-django)) is disabling this functionality behind the scenes. After looking through the wagtail database, I also found that none of these user accounts have this field set:
![pgadmin3](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/41487159/218825314-53edb526-d675-4ef6-9c0f-276f4f13eef5.JPG)


Goal: Investigate why we don't have these settings and create follow-up tickets if it's possible for us to gain this functionality.

title: Hide protected research hub detail pages from listings

labels.name: research hub 🔍
labels.description: Research Hub Project

labels.name: product
labels.description: Drive Products Forward

labels.name: RCC
labels.description: Issues related to the Responsible Computing Challenge website production

body:
### Description

Follow up from https://github.com/mozilla/foundation.mozilla.org/issues/10081

We now hide protected pages on https://foundation.mozilla.org/research/library/ but a protected page will still appear on an author page e.g 
https://foundation.mozilla.org/en/research/browse-authors/180/maximilian-gahntz/

This also seems to be an issue on the landing page, where the latest research might show protected pages: https://foundation.mozilla.org/en/research/

### Dev notes

- [ ] Search codebase for locations where we surface detail pages in a list (off the top of my head: landing page, library page, author page)
- [ ] Ensure all these locations only show live and public pages. Make sure the queryset uses `.live().public()`.

### Acceptance criteria

- [x] As an editor, I can safely publish a report landing page with a password or only available to logged-in users and know that the thumbnail will not be visible to the public
- [x] As a visitor, I only see report detail pages listed that I can click on and view 
- [x] No protected detail pages are listed on an author page.
- [x] No protected detail pages are listed in the "latest" section on the research hub landing page. 

cc @tbrlpld @kevinhowbrook

When visiting the research hub library page (https://foundation.mofostaging.net/en/research/library/) and there a non-public / protected page exists (https://foundation.mofostaging.net/en/research/library/alternative-data-governance-playbook/) then that page is listed. 

### To Reproduce

Steps to reproduce the behavior:

1. Go to the research hub library page: https://foundation.mofostaging.net/en/research/library/
2. In the admin, make one child page of the library page protected (e.g. password protected)
3. Refresh the library page
4. See see that the protected page is listed.

### Expected behavior

Needs discussion: *We should only show protected pages to logged-in users.*

body:
Issue discovered in - [[PNI] Using backspace in mobile search is very delayed #9821 ](https://github.com/mozilla/foundation.mozilla.org/issues/9821#issuecomment-1399096152)

Via @tbrlpld 
> I am experiencing some weirdness with the visibility of the search bar now. Seems like the search bar is sometimes hidden or blocked by the dropdown when scrolling back up. Also, it sometimes takes quite some time for the grid items to show again. 

This bug has been confirmed by me and @beccaklam

### AC
- [ ] (on mobile) As a user, if I click on the magnifying glass icon to activate search mode, I can see the search bar becomes sticky as I scroll the page.
- [ ] (on mobile) As a user, if search mode is not on, I can see the category bar becomes sticky as I scroll the page.
- [ ] (on mobile) As a user, when search mode is activated, the top right magnifying glass icon becomes a 'x' button which can be used to close the search bar

### Describe the bug
On mobile, the search bar is sometimes hidden or blocked by the dropdown when scrolling down and then back up. 

### To Reproduce
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to https://foundation.mozilla.org/en/privacynotincluded/ with an iPhone
2. Click on the search icon
3. Type something, e.g. "Garmin"
4. Scroll down 
5. Scroll back up
6. See error

### Expected behavior
The active search is still visible when I scroll back up.

title: [PNI] Show featured CTA when navigating from landing to category page

labels.name: buyer's guide 🛍
labels.description: Issues related to the buyer's guide

labels.name: support
labels.description: Support colleagues in achieving their goals through digital

body:
## Description

This is a follow up to #9853. 

When navigating from the PNI landing page to a category page (the category has the "show CTA" flag set to "True") the CTA is not displayed in the product grid. 

## Steps to reproduce

1. Create a Buyer's Guide CTA: https://foundation.mofostaging.net/cms/snippets/wagtailpages/buyersguidecalltoaction/
2. Set the created CTA as the featured CTA on the PNI landing page: https://foundation.mofostaging.net/cms/pages/1444/edit/
3. Set the show CTA flag on a product category to "True" (checked): https://foundation.mofostaging.net/cms/snippets/wagtailpages/buyersguideproductcategory/edit/2/
4. Visit the PNI landing page: https://foundation.mofostaging.net/en/privacynotincluded/
5. Click the menu entry for the category where you have set "show CTA" to "True" above, e.g. "Smart Home". 
6. See the product grid update, but the CTA does not show.

## Acceptance criteria

Given that a Buyer's Guide CTA exists and that CTA is set as the featured CTA on the PNI landing page:

- [x] As a page visitor, when I load the PNI landing page the featured CTA is not displayed inside the product grid.
- [x] As a page visitor, when I load the PNI landing page and then click the menu entry for a category I see the product grid update and the CTA is displayed inside the product grid. 
- [x] As a page visitor, when I navigate to a new category page that has the CTA flag set to false, the CTA gets cleared.
- [x] As a page visitor, when I navigate to a new category page that has the CTA flag set to true, the CTA remains visible.

title: [PNI] Switch visibility of featured CTA with category

labels.name: buyer's guide 🛍
labels.description: Issues related to the buyer's guide

labels.name: product
labels.description: Drive Products Forward

body:
## Description

This is similar to #9541. When using the category nav to switch between categories, the visibility of the featured CTA should be updated based on the selected category. 

The categories have the `show_cta` boolean that decides the visibility of the CTA. 

This is also a followup to #9555.

## Acceptance criteria

Given there are two buyer's guide product categories, one with `show_cta =  True` and one with `show_cta = False`, and a featured buyer's guide CTA is specified on the buyer's guide page:

- [x] As a site visitor, when I load the category page for the category with `show_cta = 
True` I see the featured CTA.
- [x] As a site visitor, when I load the category page for the category with `show_cta = False` I **do not** see the CTA.
- [x] As a site visitor, when first I load the category page for the category with `show_cta = False` I **do not see** the featured CTA, but when I switch the active category with the category nav then I **do see** the featured CTA.

title: [PNI] Using backspace in mobile search is very delayed

labels.name: buyer's guide 🛍
labels.description: Issues related to the buyer's guide

body:
### Describe the bug

In the mobile search bar on the PNI homepage, when using backspace it takes a long time for the text to actually disappear. The problem seems to get worse the more often the key is used. 

It seems like this has something to do with the debounce.

### To Reproduce

Steps to reproduce the behavior:

1. Go to https://foundation.mozilla.org/en/privacynotincluded/ with an iPhone.
2. Click on the search icon.
3. Type something, e.g. "Germin".
4. Try to correct your typo by backspacing.
5. Notice that it takes a long time for the text to disappear.
6. Once the text does disappear, try typing new text, e.g. "Garmin"
7. This will also not appear immediately character-by-character, but take some time and then appear all at once.

### Expected behavior

When hitting the backspace the text should disappear immediately.


### Screenshots

Here is a screen recording. In times where it seems like nothing is happening, I am typing or trying to delete... That is the issue.

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/24797493/206480747-c198e9f6-cb34-431d-bedf-eb16c304be4b.MP4

 - OS: iOS 
 - Browser: Safari (but does not matter)

title: Don't format code in CI

labels.name: maintain
labels.description: Maintain digital systems

body:
# Description

It is currently possible to pass CI with code that needs to be formatted.
This can lead to files being formatted when testing locally that you have not touched which is really confusing.

The above happens because in CI we run `npm test` and some of the `test:*` commands use the `prettier` flag [`--write`](https://prettier.io/docs/en/cli.html#--write). 
With this flag, the issue `prettier` finds are fixed and the files overwritten. 

We should not fix formatting issues in CI, because these fixes are not committed to the code base. 
Rather, we should check the formatting in CI and not allow code that is failing the formatting to be merged.
To make fixing formatting issue easy, we should add a separate command to fix `prettier` formatting issues.

# Acceptance criteria

- [x] CI does not pass if it's run with code that does not pass `prettier` style rules.
- [x] There is a `npm` command to check `prettier` style rules.

title: [PNI] Category nav pushes search bar off screen during load

labels.name: buyer's guide 🛍
labels.description: Issues related to the buyer's guide

body:
# Description

During load of the JS the categories are pushing the search bar of screen. 

https://images.zenhubusercontent.com/76596293/6b5050a6-ff9d-451f-9558-1b540c09feac/screen_recording_2022_11_09_at_06_34_36.mov

This feels visually a bit disruptive. 

When loading the page without JS, I can never reach the categories or search bar that are off screen. 

# Expected behavior

* Search bar stays where it, regardless if JS has loaded / is active or not.
* Before JS loads (of when JS is deactivated), the categories are allowed to overflow their container and non-visible categories can be reached with horizontal scrolling.
* When JS loads, the horizontally overflowing categories are moved into the "more" dropdown.

title: use_wide_template field not being synced across localizations
body:
### Describe the bug
Related Ticket: #9642 

While working on the ticket above, I noticed that the `use_wide_template` field is not being synced across the different localized versions of mozfest pages.

For example, take this page titled "Call for Proposals". In the English version, we can see that the field `use_wide_template` is set to `True`.

![Screenshot 2022-11-08 at 15-38-07 Wagtail - Editing Mozfest primary page Call For Proposals](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/18314510/200699481-9eac18c0-f141-4fca-ace4-9d6c5d0a71cb.png)

Here is a screenshot of the page's front end, with some edited HTML to show what the field is set to:

![Screenshot 2022-11-08 at 15-37-04 Submit your MozFest Session before December 16th](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/18314510/200699607-be319a98-39fb-43cd-8501-3ae72d743a9d.png)


When visiting the French rendition of the page, it appears that the `use_wide_template` field is still set to False, even after clicking "Sync all translations".

![Screenshot 2022-11-08 at 15-37-27 Proposez votre session pour le MozFest avant le 16 décembre](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/18314510/200699743-7172cd3f-2762-4a6e-ae13-3022002df71c.png)


### Expected behavior
The expected behavior is that if the page's `use_wide_template` field should be consistent across all translations once you click "Sync all translations".

title: Sign up snippets not syncing across translations
body:
## Describe the bug
Signup snippet changes on mozfest pages are not being synchronized, even after clicking "sync translations".

**From Slack:**
The sign up snippet got removed from the updated English page https://www.mozillafestival.org/en/proposals/ in order to use the full width, but syncing translations doesn’t remove it from translated pages.

## Steps to reproduce

1. Visit https://www.mozillafestival.org/en/proposals/, note that there is no signup snippet set.
![Screenshot 2022-11-08 at 14-18-01 Submit your MozFest Session before December 16th](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/18314510/200687907-e6ae8480-cb4f-4531-98c3-7529fe4b87eb.png)

2. Visit https://www.mozillafestival.org/fr/proposals/, and note that there is **still** a signup snippet on the page, even after clicking "sync translations".
![Screenshot 2022-11-08 at 14-18-24 Proposez votre session pour le MozFest avant le 16 décembre](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/18314510/200688015-3c04798e-ee67-4132-a19a-bc9d8056eeee.png)


## Expected behavior

If a mozfest page removes/changes it's linked signup snippet, its localized versions should show the same change after clicking "sync translations".

# Description

There is a bug on the product review page when switching category filters. 

1. Visit the product review page: https://foundation-pni-2022.herokuapp.com/en/privacynotincluded/categories/best-of/
2. Notice the title matching the selected category filter
3. Click a different category filter.

The title should update to the newly selected category. 


# Acceptance criteria

- [x] As a user, when I visit the product review page and switch between categories to filter, the title updates with the selected category title.

title: Campaign page narrow content not working

[Preview app](https://foundation-pni-2022.herokuapp.com/en/privacynotincluded/)

body:
# Description

The PNI editorial content index page does not save the pagination state when navigation with the "load more" botton. 
This means when the page is refreshed it page starts only displaying the first page. 

This can lead to navigation issues for users. If for some reason (storage full, etc.) the pages are not cached properly, navigating back to the index might show a different state than the user left. E.g. navigating from the index (after clicking the "load more" button) to an article and back to the index would show only the first page of the index again. 

To avoid this, we should save the state of the pagination with the "load more" button. 

# Dev notes

* Updating the history and URL is possible with [`hx-push-state`](https://htmx.org/attributes/hx-push-url/). 
* We need to avoid this functionality from colliding with the "non-JS" pagination that is first loaded and only replaced with the "load more" functionality. E.g. when directly navigating to the index with `?page=2` it should still show only the second page of articles. We should be able to use a second query parameter, e.g. `expanded`, to signal that we should render all articles from all pages from the first to the requested one. E.g. `?page=2&expanded` shows all articles form the first page and all articles from the second page. The "non-JS" pagination would still go to a normal `?page=3` which would only show the articles of the third page. The "load more" button should add the articles from the thrid page to the current index (and update the active URL accordingly). 


# Acceptance criteria

- [x] As a user, when I visit the content index page, click the "load more" button I can see the URL now includes the page and expansion query parameters (`?page=2&expanded`).
- [x] As a user, when I visit the content index page, click the "load more" button and refresh the page, I find the index page in the same state (shows all the loaded articles) as before the refresh.

body: ### Describe the bug https://foundation.mozilla.org/en/campaigns/youtube-user-controls/ On the Youtube User Controls Petition page, a couple of the buttons that appear after the petition is signed are not working. Debated on splitting this into two issues but I'm betting they're very closely related. The "Twitter" button just opens a small popup of this same page, it does not go to Twitter. Click on "Twitter" and "Email" buttons as shown in the image below. ### Expected behavior The Twitter button should open a window that tweets the petition page. If this is unclear then we need to talk about it and grab details from the stakeholders. The Email button should be an a tag with mailto, subject, and body. title: Updating the 'form_submission' data layer change to only fire after ticking the privacy box in the newsletter signup form

labels.name: support
labels.description: Support colleagues in achieving their goals through digital

body:
### Describe the bug
After doing some testing on the 'form_submission' data layer change - [#8956 ](https://github.com/mozilla/foundation.mozilla.org/issues/8956)
the GTM event will fire twice if the user first clicks sign up without ticking the checkbox (I'm okay with Mozilla handling my info as explained in this Privacy Notice), i.e it fires before the form is successfully submitted. This applies to each placement of the sign up form, eg header, footer, and the callout box.

I've attached two screenshots that show the tag firing before the form has been submitted (error message visible in red), and then again once the error is corrected and the form is successfully submitted. 

**Can we fix this so that the box must be ticked before an event is fired?**

### Screenshots 
![Screenshot 2022-07-20 at 11 07 02 (1)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/102978346/181248892-8b799b2c-a99f-4e83-b2dd-5f2f71d71596.png)

![Screenshot 2022-07-20 at 11 07 19](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/102978346/181249030-696fc4b4-0d40-495c-9d6a-b68c47c32c64.png)


### Acceptance criteria
- [x] The privacy box must be ticked before firing the form_submission event in [foundation.mozilla.org](https://foundation.mozilla.org/)
- [x] The privacy box must be ticked before firing the form_submission event in [www.mozillafestival.org](https://www.mozillafestival.org/)
- [ ] The privacy box must be ticked before firing the form_submission event in [/mozillapulse.org](https://mozillapulse.org/)

title: Private pages are returning 500 error

labels.name: wagtail
labels.description: wagtail related issues

body:
### Describe the bug
Stakeholders are experiencing 500 errors when trying to visit a page that is set to private.
The page that was used to reproduce the bug is https://foundation.mozilla.org/en/blog/regretsreporter-user-controls-study-1/

### To Reproduce
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to https://foundation.mozilla.org/en/blog/regretsreporter-user-controls-study-1/
2. Make page private
3. Visit again and note the 500 error

### Expected behavior
This depends on what the privacy can be set to. For example, if i set it to private with a password, there should be a text box to enter the password to view the page. 


On prod, we instead get a 500 error. And on localhost we get this error:
![Screenshot 2022-05-11 at 10-16-26 AttributeError at _en_blog_initial-test-blog-post-with-fixed-title_](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/18314510/167908781-7be8e71e-77bf-493e-bb60-953afee9e471.png)

### Additional context
The line that is producing the error can be found on [blog.py line 222](https://github.com/mozilla/foundation.mozilla.org/blob/fcafac3057cb4defe4a683ec97a3844dd88fc106/network-api/networkapi/wagtailpages/pagemodels/blog/blog.py#L222)

title: Buyers guide search bar crashes on iPhone

labels.name: buyer's guide 🛍
labels.description: Issues related to the buyer's guide

labels.name: support
labels.description: Support colleagues in achieving their goals through digital

body:
### Describe the bug

When I try to use the search bar, I can type the search term on the keyboard, but the first letters only only appear with quite some delay and after 5 or so letters no further ones appear and the the page becomes completely unresponsive.


### To Reproduce

Use an iPhone 6 with iOS 15.3

Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to https://foundation.mozilla.org/en/privacynotincluded/
2. Click on search bar
3. Start typing a longer term, eg "galaxy watch 3"
4. See only the first couple letters appear, eg "galax" and notice no further letters appear. I can also not clear the search bar. The page becomes completely unresponsive to the point that I have to close the browser window.

### Expected behavior

I can type search terms and see results below.


### Screenshots
If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/24797493/163605383-04eb7c47-225c-440d-82b5-483970291242.png)

### Smartphone (please complete the following information):
 - Device:  iPhone6 
 - OS: iOS 15.3
 - Browser safari

## Acceptance criteria

- [ ] Privacynotincluded search bar should work for adding search bar items on iphones
- [ ] Make sure routing from categories and using history navigation is still working without JS errors
- [ ] The above tests should still work on other browsers/devices

## Dev Tasks

- [ ] Emulate iphone with local dev enviornment
- [ ] Investigate JS error that crashes the entire page
- [ ] Might possibly have disable search bar until images load
- [ ] Might have to add a debounce on the search bar

title: [Interactive Report] Sticky Nav not showing when Hero Header is selected
body:
**April 28 2022 Update:**
So I think this bug actually extends to any page using the new Hero Header.

### Describe the bug
I'm building an example page for the new Interactive Report features and noticed the sticky nav is not showing on my page: https://foundation.mozilla.org/en/docs/how-do-i-wagtail/youtube-regrets-findings/

### To Reproduce
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to any article page (e.g. 'https://foundation.mozilla.org/en/docs/how-do-i-wagtail/youtube-regrets-findings/') and under Hero Layout make sure either 'Full Screen', 'Image Left' or 'Image Right' is selected
2. Save draft/preview or publish/view live
3. Scroll down to past the summary box
4. See that the sticky nav does not appear

### Expected behavior
The sticky nav should appear once you have scrolled past the summary box. Example here: https://foundation.mozilla.org/en/campaigns/exporting-disinformation-how-foreign-groups-peddle-influence-in-kenya-through-twitter/ This page appears to work because it is using the old page header (Hero layout: 'Static')

### Screenshots
![Screen Shot 2022-04-13 at 2.56.36 PM.png](https://images.zenhubusercontent.com/57acd65ce40e5714b16d4215/a5197234-bb1d-445c-9492-23d8b344b14f)

title: Visual issues with the publication menu on translated pages
body: Looks like the menu was not designed to handle multi-line labels, and so when "SHOW ALL" translation results in a longer string, it’s wrapping on a second line and causing a couple visual issues. This is currently affecting French, German, Polish, Dutch and Frisian. ### When opening the menu, there’s a weird “bump” https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1294206/163192396-04fdfe29-a2de-4d99-9c0c-c192aca743a1.mov ### The menu is visible below the site header When opening a publication page in one of the affected locales, e.g. https://foundation.mozilla.org/fr/insights/trustworthy-ai-whitepaper/path-forward/introduction-theory-change/ you will notice the lower part of the menu is visible below the site header

title: [Interactive Report] Child Publications not displaying Parent Publications Menu

labels.name: product
labels.description: Drive Products Forward

body:
### Describe the bug
Currently, when a user clicks into a child Publication, the menu updates to only show the child Publication's table of contents vs the parent Publication's table of contents.

![Screenshot 2022-04-11 at 10-17-22 Introduction to the Theory of Change.png](https://images.zenhubusercontent.com/57acd65ce40e5714b16d4215/58a60005-76fd-4381-aa1e-79a043a3e393)

### To Reproduce
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to 'https://foundation.mozilla.org/en/insights/trustworthy-ai-whitepaper/path-forward/introduction-theory-change/'
2. Click on 'SHOW ALL' in the sticky menu
3. See that only the table of contents for 'The Path Forward' is shown vs the table of contents for 'Creating Trustworthy AI'

### Expected behavior
Since the child publication is part of a parent publication we would still want access to the parent publication's table of contents as well.

![image.png](https://images.zenhubusercontent.com/57acd65ce40e5714b16d4215/51375b39-8943-4207-87da-1f8d84707ae8)


### Additional context
This may need some further design to think about what will be displayed in the menu

labels.name: buyer's guide 🛍
labels.description: Issues related to the buyer's guide

body: When using the checkbox to filter dinged products on the PNI homepage, dinged products remain hidden Steps to reproduce: - Open https://foundation.mozilla.org/en/privacynotincluded/ - Tick the “*Privacy not included” checkbox

title: Investigation | Dropdown Boxes are using default browser styling instead of mofo styling
body:
### Describe the bug
Design team has reached out to let us know dropdowns such as the ones found on https://foundation.mozilla.org/en/newsletter/ appear to be using the browsers styling of dropdown items instead of ours. 

 

I think steps to solve this issue would be:

- [ ] Find out if this is to be expected, or if we had custom stylings for dropdowns in the past
- [x] If we do, we should make sure that those styles are rendered as much as possible instead of getting overridden by the browser defaults

title: Sliders on MozFest Home Page are no longer scrolling
body:
### Description
Sliders on MozFest Home Page are no longer scrolling

### To Reproduce
Steps to reproduce the behavior:

1. Go to the homepage
2. Add a Tito button
3. Preview
4. Styling issues with the progress bars or the hero and the slides are no longer functioning

### Expected behavior
A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen.


### Additional context
See original Slack post here: https://mozilla.slack.com/archives/C98GW3P7X/p1644592678666559

title: Updating PDF isn't working
body:
I would like to update the PDF in this link https://assets.mofoprod.net/network/documents/Personalized_Pricing.pdf without breaking the link ulr since it's been used with press and across our site.

I can typically do this via Documents when the PDF url is https://foundation.mozilla.org/documents/[number]/[name].pdf

However in this case, updating the PDF via Documents doesn't seem to be working. Documents  has the url https://foundation.mozilla.org/documents/241/Personalized_Pricing.pdf. I am unsure of were https://assets.mofoprod.net/network/documents/ comes from.

Acceptance criteria:

- [x] fix the way pdf links are presented in wagtail
- [x] update any CSM page with links to pdf documents
- [x] update the actual document at the S3 location

title: UTM query args may be going missing
body:
Submitted on behalf of Audrey:

Question! If I make a button, like on this page https://foundation.mozilla.org/blog/new-research-tinders-opaque-unfair-pricing-algorithm-can-charge-users-up-to-five-times-more-for-same-service/ I noticed that the UTM info gets stripped when you click on it. So for example, I don’t think I would know how many people signed the petition having come to that page from Twitter. How do I stop that from happening?

title: Github CI will fail python testing over missing migrations, while local testing shows no errors at all
body:
This is holding up some singificant PRs.

- [ ] verify every single django/wagtail-related dependency used on CI is the same as used for local work
- [ ] update a PR's CI settings to use a datatabase url that can be inspected after the run fails, to see what it actually applied?

self.nodelist.render(context) 2022-02-01T17:15:39.110208+00:00 app[web.4]: File "/app/.heroku/python/lib/python3.9/site-packages/django/template/base.py", line 938, in render 2022-02-01T17:15:39.110209+00:00 app[web.4]: File "/app/.heroku/python/lib/python3.9/site-packages/django/template/library.py", line 192, in render 2022-02-01T17:15:39.110210+00:00 app[web.4]: output = self.func(*resolved_args, **resolved_kwargs) 2022-02-01T17:15:39.110210+00:00 app[web.4]: File "/app/network-api/networkapi/wagtailpages/templatetags/homepage_tags.py", line 46, in get_page_authors 2022-02-01T17:15:39.110210+00:00 app[web.4]: all_authors = page.authors.all() 2022-02-01T17:15:39.110211+00:00 app[web.4]: AttributeError: 'str' object has no attribute 'authors' ```
So it looks like there's a codepage where a template tag that expects a `Page` as argument is instead getting a string somehow. Local testing - `inv copy-prod-db` - http://localhost:8000/en/blog/why-our-tech-community-is-most-excited-about-mozfest-2022/ should crash identically --- From investigations by @tbrlpld: I am wondering though if the comment is accurate though? `BlogPage.ensure_related_posts` is adding the posts that are returned by `BlogPage.get_missing_related_posts` to the `related_posts` field (which is the orderable through model). Also, the issue does also occur in preview. To fill the list in preview it is also `BlogPage.get_missing_related_posts` that is used. So it would appear that the issue should be in that method. But `BlogPage.get_missing_related_posts` does seem to always return a list of posts or an empty list. I don't think there is a way how an element of that list could be `None`. Looking at the example page in the admin, I noticed that the last "related blog post" item does not have an actual page selected: This is possible because of how we define the `RelatedBlogPost.related_post` field. ```python class RelatedBlogPosts(Orderable): ... related_post = models.ForeignKey( 'wagtailpages.BlogPage', blank=True, null=True, on_delete=models.SET_NULL, ) ... ``` This, I think, is where `None` could get into the list of related posts. This is because, we allow the related post to be blank and when the related page is deleted we set the field to null. I don't think the through model serves any purpose when the related page is deleted and we could probably delete the through model with it. I am also unsure what the use-case would be for editors to create the through model item without actually selecting the related page. It might be clearer to have to select a page if a throug model item is created. I would therefore propose to change the definition here like so: ```python class RelatedBlogPosts(Orderable): ... related_post = models.ForeignKey( 'wagtailpages.BlogPage', blank=False, null=True, on_delete=models.CASCADE, ) ... ``` This should remove the orderable/through model when the related page is deleted and will notify editors to enter valid data. We could still keep the filter in place as a defensive mechanism (although I am not sure how `None` would enter the list of related posts).

title: Donate: Inbound link broken - 404
body:
A [review ](https://datastudio.google.com/reporting/12b9f4b6-c354-4f1a-9d08-749a36d08789/page/qAvjC)of our website analytics flags that there is broken inbound donate link:

donate.mozilla.org/en-US/page/contribute/Give-Now/?source=mozillaorg_default_footer&ref=firefox_about&tm_source=firefox&tm_medium=referral

We can't find where this page was intended to go, and it's not a link type that we use. We also can't find the source (i.e. where this link is coming from).

It's a not-insignificant amount of traffic we should be directing to a real donate page

title: Snippets not letting you save after making changes
body:
### Describe the bug
I tried to change the share image or add in a share image to a product category page of PNI and it doesn't let me save with the error that "A category with the name already exists". This happens with a few other categories I've tried. 

### To Reproduce

body:
### Describe the bug
When I click into accordion 04 (“YouTube Regrets can alter people’s lives forever”) on my 15" Macbook Pro, the right arrow, and a bit of the left arrow, is cut off so I can’t access the next carousel screen unless I move my browser to a bigger display.

### To Reproduce
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to 'https://foundation.mozilla.org/en/youtube/findings/'
2. Scroll down near the bottom of the page and click on accordion 04: (“YouTube Regrets can alter people’s lives forever”)

### Expected behavior
Two arrows should been seen and accessible.

Just like [for Donate](https://github.com/mozilla/donate-wagtail/issues/1610), mergify changed its yaml format, so we'll need to update things here, too.

See the [PR for donate](https://github.com/mozilla/donate-wagtail/pull/1611/files) for concrete changes.

title: PNI has duplicate categories in the prod db
body:
Running wagtailpages migration 0064 on the prod db crashes on this line:

```python
    BuyersGuideProductCategory = apps.get_model("wagtailpages", "BuyersGuideProductCategory")
    healthAndExercise = BuyersGuideProductCategory.objects.get(name="Health & Exercise") <--
```

because apparently more than one category has this name. Which should not be the case. It looks like wagtailpages/buyersguideproductcategory id:5 and wagtailpages/buyersguideproductcategory id:61 both have the "Health & Exercise" name, despite #61 supposedly being a Polish translation (and so shouldn't be the same string)

- Hit save

title: Update UTM Parameters for RegretsReporter download/email buttons
body:
The desired workflow for these buttons is that if there are no utm parameters, for example if someone visits the page on their own, we will have some default UTM parameters appended to the links for the download and email buttons.

However, if someone visits the page from one of the marketing efforts such as twitter/email/etc we want the UTM parameters to get appended to the same buttons, that way when we visit the download pages we can know what brought them there.

labels.description: Issues related to the buyer's guide

body:
Some PNI sub-categories are broken in non-EN locales when you click on them from a category page.

**Step 1**: Open https://foundation.mozilla.org/fr/privacynotincluded/categories/smart-home/
**Step 2**: Click on one of the sub-categories, for instance `Aspirateurs robots`
**Step 3**:  Try clicking on other sub-categories or categories, it won’t work

### Two issues:
- The filtering didn’t work (it’s showing up the `All` category, with all products)
- You’re now stuck and can’t click on any category or sub-category without reloading the page


One interesting part is that the issue doesn’t affect all sub categories, for instance sub-categories here are working: https://foundation.mozilla.org/fr/privacynotincluded/categories/wearables/

One more note, accessing sub-categories directly [does work](https://foundation.mozilla.org/fr/privacynotincluded/categories/robot-vacuums/), it’s just the dynamic filtering while browsing that’s broken

title: PNI checkbox is cut-off in German on Desktop
body: The "* Privacy not included" checkbox is currently cut-off in German on Desktop, we should make it properly wrap in two lines (or give it more space, if possible)

title: Some PNI product pages are crashing

labels.name: buyer's guide 🛍
labels.description: Issues related to the buyer's guide

body:

`django.urls.exceptions.NoReverseMatch: Reverse for 'category-view' with arguments '('',)' not found. 1 pattern(s) tried: ['categories/(?P<slug>[\\w\\W]+)/']`

title: [PNI] QA - changing categories can scroll the page

labels.name: buyer's guide 🛍
labels.description: Issues related to the buyer's guide

milestone.title: PNI Q3 2021
milestone.description: PNI updates for the November 2021 update

body: When loading the PNI homepage, scrolling down a bit to see products, and clicking a category, will scroll the user back to the top of the page, which is probably undesirable UX.

title: [PNI QA] AI-related fields not hidden on translated pages for products that don’t use AI

labels.name: buyer's guide 🛍
labels.description: Issues related to the buyer's guide

body: Example here: https://foundation.mozilla.org/fr/privacynotincluded/sonos-one-sl/ This product doesn’t use an AI, and the AI related fields are hidden on the English page, but are still visible on the French page. English: French:

title: Increase character limit for PNI category names

labels.name: buyer's guide 🛍
labels.description: Issues related to the buyer's guide

body:
sync_git is failing with French translations of some PNI product category names. I’d suggest we set that limit to 100 chars to keep a margin.

title: Link buttons on articles are misaligned
body: ### Describe the bug It appears that link buttons on article pages are appearing misaligned with the rest of the content: However after looking at the style guide to see what buttons should look like on a page, it appears to be centered. We should reach out to the designers to see whether or not the button should be centered. If so, make the buttons centered in the middle of the content, if not, have it left aligned with the rest of the content

title: Pages have two `<link rel="canonical">`  elements
body: In the head section. There should be only one. Perhaps one is auto generated by wagtail-localize?

title: RSS feed description should output meta description instead of encoded html
body:
Currently the RSS feed outputs encoded page html instead of the page's meta description.
The RSS feed description fields should be the corresponding article's meta description.

See: https://foundation.mozilla.org/en/blog/rss/

The meta description behaviour should follow the existing meta description behaviour (if Meta Description is filled in on the promote tab, display that, otherwise display the first 153 characters of the article with an ellipsis at the end)

title: [PNI] QA - product categories may be null, which can break the product_in_category check

milestone.title: PNI Q3 2021
milestone.description: PNI updates for the November 2021 update

body: The "product in category?" check runs a `[cat.category.slug for cat in productpage.product_categories.all()]` check, which will beak if there are `null` entries in `productpage.product_categories.all()` because it will effectively try to resolve `None.slug`.

title: [PNI] subcategories - you can save new categories with the same name as old ones
body: This will cause a slug resolution conflict, so we should make sure that when people try to save a new category it checks to see if that name isn't already taken.

title: RSS Feed Displaying in body text
body: ### Describe the bug The Slack RSS feed is rendering `` into the post summary. Seems to be stripping other html from the post summary, but not this string. ### To Reproduce 1. Create a new Wagtail blog post with a rich text field and a fragment identifier in the first paragraph 2. Publish page 3. RSS renders properly in #mofo-website-new-blogs except for `` You can also see an example here so you don't need to publish new pages on prod: https://mozilla.slack.com/archives/C02999LNN2D/p1635798952000100 ### Expected behavior The anchor should not appear in the summary ### Screenshots ![image.png](https://images.zenhubusercontent.com/5fc93ac187345c0cf1d7ae58/bfa85aa5-4464-4b2a-85f8-a7e1d758a085) ### Additional context After a brief initial investigation, it might be because of the Slack RSS feed renderer, which, if it is, we might not be able to anything about. We should still investigate to see if that is the actual cause of the error.

title: Page elements below the "regrets" content cannot be clicked on https://foundation.mozilla.org/en/campaigns/regrets-reporter/
body:
### Describe the bug

The https://foundation.mozilla.org/en/campaigns/regrets-reporter/ page has a "donate now" button at the bottom, like most of our pages, that folks can click to donate to the Mozilla Foundation. However, hovering the mouse over the button does not show it as being active, and clicking does nothing. Some further testing shows that nothing below main page content is interactible. 

The reason for this is that there are invisible divs on top of it: both `intro-text-container` and `scene-container` divs are overlayed with a height:100% irrespective of scroll position, meaning they cover the donate button as well as our footer.

title: Numbers in templates are still getting localized

labels.name: maintain
labels.description: Maintain digital systems

milestone.title: Foundation Maintenance Q4
milestone.description: Maintenance issues that should be tackled by Q4 2022 in priority order.

body: This is caused by `L10N=True`: even though we removed `USE_THOUSAND_SEPARATOR`, which turns this behaviour off for English/default, the `L10N` setting "overrules" that and turns on silent number reformatting with even less control. There is the `{{ value | unlocalize }}` template filter from the `l10n` tags that we can use, but it would be fantastic if we can find out how to actually turns this off for every locale, except where `intcomma` is explicitly used.

title: All review apps have mozfest set as default website, breaking navigation for PNI
body:
Review apps get bootstrapped with a dual site setup, where both the foundation and mozfest homepages are bound to port 80, with the mozfest site as default website. This unfortunately means that the majority of review apps are pulling pages and nav links based on the wrong domain name, and navigation on, for example, PNI pages goes rather wrong.

It also looks like the names for these entries aren't quite right, so maybe it's just a matter of swapping the domain names for "foundation" and "mozfest"?

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/177243/134562121-3770b832-b927-4561-9f3b-7e3bb28431cd.png)

Also, looking at the domains bound, they seem to point to `mofostaging.net` rather than `herokuapp.com`

title: PNI ordering of news updates doesn't work in the CMS

labels.name: wagtail
labels.description: wagtail related issues

labels.name: buyer's guide 🛍
labels.description: Issues related to the buyer's guide

milestone.title: PNI Q3 2021
milestone.description: PNI updates for the November 2021 update

body:
When I try to reorder the news updates with up/down arrows in the CMS they don't seem to save and reorder. They move around but once I save, they seem to revert back to the order they were before. 


### To Reproduce
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to any PNI product page in the CMS. Go down to the product updates section near the bottom.
2. Click on the up or down arrows to reorder a news updates
3. Scroll down save draft. 
4. Now go down and see if they updates are reordered in the order you'd hoped. They keep jumping around or not reordering for me. 

### Expected behavior
The updates reorder into the order I placed them and stay that way once saved and published.

### Screenshots
If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem.

### Desktop (please complete the following information):
 - OS: [e.g. iOS]

title: add PNI voting to the tests
body: PNI product voting may not have been working for 10 months, and we didn't know. This needs a test that tries to submit a value out-of-band and then confirms the numbers didn't change, as well as submitting a value with proper CSRF values, and then confirms the numbers _did_ change, so we never have a repeat of this situation...

title: PNI voting seems to be broken for (some) products?
body:
Looking at the database, there are a bunch of products with zero-vote data:
```
wagtail=# select distinct(title) from (
    select
        page.id, page.title as title, product.page_ptr_id, votes.id
    from
        wagtailcore_page as page,
        wagtailpages_productpage as product,
        wagtailpages_productpagevotes as votes
    where
        votes.vote_bins='0,0,0,0,0'
        and product.votes_id = votes.id
        and page.id = product.page_ptr_id
) as subquery order by title;

                      title
--------------------------------------------------
 BlueJeans
 Discord
 Doxy.me
 Facebook Messenger (and Facebook Messenger Kids)
 FaceTime
 Google Duo/Google Hangouts/Google Meet
 GoToMeeting
 Houseparty
 Jitsi Meet
 Marco Polo
 Ring Indoor Cam
 Signal
 Skype
 Slack
 Teams
 Telegram
 Threema
 Viber
 Webex
 WeChat
 WhatsApp
 Zoom
(22 rows)
```

And we need to figure out why voting does not work for these products, specifically.

title: Broken share buttons on article pages
body: Share buttons at the bottom of article pages are broken. It’s currently broken on https://foundation.mozilla.org/en/campaigns/tiktok-german-election-2021/ haven’t looked other article pages, but it’s not broken on blog pages. They link to: https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u= https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text= mailto:?&body= Interestingly, the small versions of those buttons on the same page (top left) are working: …

title: Snippet chooser panel for blog categories should not show non-English entries
body: Translated categories are showing up in the category picker, we should only show the English ones I believe filtering should happen here? https://github.com/mozilla/foundation.mozilla.org/blob/main/network-api/networkapi/wagtailpages/pagemodels/blog/blog_category.py#L55

title: Blog posts are not sorted in chronological order
body:
On https://foundation.mozilla.org/en/blog/ blog posts are no longer sorted by chronological order.

Currently, https://foundation.mozilla.org/en/blog/announcing-common-voices-kiswahili-community-event-this-august/ appears first while we definitely posted multiple blog posts afterwards

title: PNI: Search in Snippets --> Buyers Guide Product Updates Returns Server Error (500)
body:
### Describe the bug
When I try to search for a news article I've added to Snippets --> Buyers Guide Product Updates it returns a Server Error (500)

### To Reproduce
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to https://foundation.mozilla.org/cms/snippets/wagtailpages/update/?locale=en
2. Click on search
3. Search for anything, like Facebook or Slack
4. See error --> Gives me a "Server Error (500)"

### Expected behavior
I expect it to return all the articles we've uploaded that match the search request

### Screenshots
If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem.

### Desktop (please complete the following information):

### Smartphone (please complete the following information):

It makes it hard to find and edit news articles

title: Pulse/Wagtail interface breaking links
body:
### Describe the bug
Four digit pulse profiles generate a broken link on this page https://foundation.mozilla.org/en/insights/team/.
Somehow a comma is inserted after the first digit of a four digit pulse profile. In Wagtail itself, there is no extra comma. Example: Ramak Molavi's profile takes you to https://www.mozillapulse.org/profile/5,079 instead of https://www.mozillapulse.org/profile/5079. It does not do this with the 2-3 digit Pulse profiles.

title: links are overflowing on publication pages
body:
### Describe the bug
It appears that links on publication pages are overflowing, causing the page to have a large black bar on the right side of the content. 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/18314510/132774378-e7639568-750a-42e0-b304-750003245e55.png)

title: Blog social metadata is incorrect
body:
### Describe the bug
In Mozilla Slack channel #mofo-website-new-blogs, which pulls an RSS feed of MoFo blogs, the previews render boilerplate text. This only seems to show up in this channel, with the RSS feed -so likely not a huge priority to solve, just want to make sure it's not an issue that's showing up elsewhere.

### To Reproduce
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to  #mofo-website-new-blogs
2. view content pulled in from RSS feed
3. See error

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/46638654/132763394-42b7fa25-6381-4a9e-9a8a-2f242fcb3a55.png)

title: Fix the auto-heading-link code for wagtail streamfield RichText headings
body:
Rich text headings with apostrophes lead to fragments ids with `x27` in them: ```html


Someone's Fancy Header

``` This should be id `someones-fancy-header` instead. We'll need to update the `add_id_attribute` function in `wagtailcustom_tags.py to make sure we slugify the heading text before we set it as `id` attribute. Marked as "deadline" as there is a campaign that launches on September 16 that relies on this functionality not being broken.

title: Author images not showing on blog pages
body:
### Describe the bug
We have gotten reports that author images are not appearing for blog posts on both mozfest and the mofo blog.

title: CloudFlare is stripping UTM tags again
PNI: "About this guide" linking to English page

labels.name: buyer's guide 🛍
labels.description: Issues related to the buyer's guide

body:
On https://foundation.mozilla.org/fr/privacynotincluded/ "À propos de ce guide" in the header links to https://foundation.mozilla.org/en/privacynotincluded/about/why/

That’s a fairly recent regression, I believe

title: Publications: author images missing
body:
"Author images on publications have vanished and also do not appear on new publications."

See here: https://foundation.mozilla.org/en/data-futures-lab/data-for-empowerment/

- [ ] Notify Kaili and Solana of the fix

title: makemessages command is broken for JS files
body: `inv makemessages` is currently broken. It run once for django templates, then fails when running for the JS files. It turns out I forgot to add the `--all` arg when duplicating the command

title: JS translations are not updated when switching locales
body:
Opening https://foundation.mozilla.org/fr/campaigns/regrets-reporter/findings/ then switching to another locale won’t update translations for the JS components (here, charts) unless you force-reload the page. That’s because we’re caching the JavaScriptCatalog for an hour, and the catalog only contains translations for the current locale.

I initially set a 1h cache as a precaution because I thought it included all locales, but it does not, so we should just remove the cache (we have Cloudflare cache anyway)

title: PNI category name untranslated in page title
body: On PNI category pages, the category name in the page title is left untranslated

title: PNI product images aren’t centered

labels.name: buyer's guide 🛍
labels.description: Issues related to the buyer's guide

body: Product images aren’t centered anymore, but visually left-aligned. I assume it’s not intended :) Tested on Firefox & Chrome

title: factory code ends up showing computer-nonsense
body: From https://github.com/mozilla/foundation.mozilla.org/pull/7236:

title: PNI menu is only matching browser language settings
body: With a browser set with French as the preferred language, opening PNI in any language will serve me the menu in French. Here’s an example with https://foundation.mozilla.org/de/privacynotincluded/ opened in a French Firefox: Impact should be low (after all, we’re serving the language people said they preferred), but it does look confusing. It should be matching the current page locale instead

title: Missing publish date on alias blog pages
body:
Page aliases for blog posts are currently showing `not published yet` while the original /en page is published. E.g:
- Page  alias: https://foundation.mozilla.org/es/blog/announcing-common-voices-kiswahili-community-event-this-august/ 
- Original: https://foundation.mozilla.org/en/blog/announcing-common-voices-kiswahili-community-event-this-august/

Wagtail is looking for the published date of the alias, we should make it look up the one from the /en page instead

title: Can’t translate MozFest home
body: Turns out we messed up the list of overridden fields for the MozFest home, leading to a crash when trying to translate it.

title: Language should not change when clicking on a blog post link
body:
### Describe the bug
Clicking on a blog post changes the language.

### To Reproduce
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to https://foundation.mozilla.org/en/blog/ (note the /en)
2. Click on any blog post that isn't a feature post
3. Location changes to /es e.g. https://foundation.mozilla.org/es/blog/announcing-common-voices-kiswahili-community-event-this-august/

### Expected behavior
The language should stay the same.

I don't think this is device or browser specific.

title: RSS feed returns 500 Server Error
body: Steps to reproduce the behavior: 1. Go to https://foundation.mozilla.org/en/blog/rss/

title: Mozfest pages not showing bullets on list items
body:
### Describe the bug
It appears that Mozfest pages are not showing the bullets on bulleted lists.

**Link to example page**: https://www.mozillafestival.org/en/working-groups/lead-a-working-group-project/

### Expected behavior
Bullets should appear next to their line items

### Screenshots
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/18314510/130121079-6dfa9f29-6775-4438-813e-22baac7ba97a.png)

title: Synchronize slug for YouTube findings page
body: The slug is localized for this page, we just need the usual translation fields override

body: Menu items currently have a weird border they used not to have Tested on iOS (Safari / Firefox) & macOS Firefox / Chrome Note: not broken on PNI

title: PNI footer layout is broken
body: Footer layout on https://foundation.mozilla.org/privacynotincluded/ is currently broken Tested on iOS (Safari / Firefox) & macOS Firefox / Chrome

title: Fix broken link on PNI

labels.name: buyer's guide 🛍

Pages using the "Recent blog entries" block are timing out most of the time — for logged in users anyway, because otherwise people are getting the cached version and it works well.

There’s an example here: https://foundation.mozilla.org/cms/pages/1935/edit/, neither Jon & I managed to get a preview

title: Prevent CloudFlare from stripping UTM tags on prod
body:
This ticket is a follow up from a follow up, here’s the recap:

#6543 was the initial attempt
#7072 fixed the issue on staging, but UTM tags are still stripped on prod, even though they are both running the same code.

✅ https://foundation.mofostaging.net/regrets?utm_campaign=youtuberegrets&utm_source=twitter&utm_medium=social&utm_content=1625741125

❌ https://foundation.mozilla.org/regrets?utm_campaign=youtuberegrets&utm_source=twitter&utm_medium=social&utm_content=1625741125

@KalobTaulien & I think CloudFlare could be stripping UTM tags too. So essentially, it was broken twice, and we addressed only one issue.

@tomusher does that ring a bell to you?

title: Campaign Pages show default header image even when adding new image
body:
### Describe the bug
On staging and prod, it appears that all bannered-campaign pages are showing the default banner image, instead of showing the uploaded banner image like so: 
![Screenshot 2021-07-15 at 11-16-45 Privacy and security on video chat](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/18314510/125837578-44e3b1c8-e8c1-4828-a188-7ff4f363f5b7.png)

### Expected behavior
If the campaign page has a custom image set to display, that image should appear instead of the default fallback image.

title: Follow-up for URL parameters support during redirects
body:
This is a follow-up ticket from https://github.com/mozilla/foundation.mozilla.org/issues/6543

It looks like the issue has been partially fixed, now `subscribed=1` is kept, but UTM tags are still stripped.

Here are a couple URL examples:

https://foundation.mozilla.org/campaigns/apples-anti-tracking-plans-iphone/?subscribed=1&utm_source=email&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=2020advocacy-fr&utm_content=appleidfathanks&utm_term=5382510
redirects me to https://foundation.mozilla.org/fr/campaigns/apples-anti-tracking-plans-iphone/?subscribed=1

https://foundation.mozilla.org/regrets?utm_campaign=youtuberegrets&utm_source=twitter&utm_medium=social&utm_content=1625741125%7C redirects me to https://foundation.mozilla.org/fr/campaigns/regrets-reporter/findings/

title: Mozfest Primary Page not working with wide format
body:
### Describe the bug
The mozfest primary page [for example, the get-to-know mozfest page](https://www.mozillafestival.org/en/get-to-know-mozfest/), is not making its format "wide" when in the single column format. 

For example, you can see that the menu is about a 12 col width, while the content below remains at col-8 even with the "wide" box being checked.

title: Anchor links lead to wrong position on MozFest page

labels.name: wagtail
labels.description: wagtail related issues

body:
### Describe the bug
I'm using anchor links to send users to the different year heading on the [On-Demand page](https://www.mozillafestival.org/on-demand/previous-festivals) of the MozFest website. When a user clicks the link they are sent to the wrong position on the page.

### To Reproduce
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to 'https://www.mozillafestival.org/on-demand/previous-festivals#mozfest-2019-healthy-ai'
2. You'll be brought to a point in the page before the MozFest 2019 | Healthy AI heading.

### Expected behavior
The link should position the page to the MozFest 2019 | Healthy AI heading

### Desktop (please complete the following information):
 - OS: MacOS 11.4
 - Browser: Chrome / Safari / FireFox

### Smartphone (please complete the following information):
 - Device: iPhone 12 Pro
 - OS: iOS 14.6
 - Browser: Safari


### Additional context
When watching the page load - it seems to load in the correct position, then the Pulse entries on the page load and push the headings down the page.

title: Step 20XX: Update the NullBoolean fields to a new ExtendedBoolean field
body:
Django 3.1 removed the `NullBoolean` field so we need to uplift the SoftwareProduct's `medical_privacy_compliant` and `easy_to_learn_and_use` fields to a new yes/no/unknown type.

- [x] create an ExtendedBooleanField similar to ExtendedYesNoField, to capture the tristate "yes", "no", "unknown".
- [x] uplift `medical_privacy_compliant` and `easy_to_learn_and_use` in `products.py`.
- [x] create a migration to copy over the nullbool values for those two fields to their new value type.
- [x] create a new filter `extended_boolean` in `bg_selector_tags.py`, similar to `extended_yes_no`
- [x] update `product_page.html` to use `|extended_boolean` instead of `|yes_no` for the two uplifted fields
- [x] verify that the CMS shows the same pulldown selectors for these values as before.

Note: these fields already got accidentally changed from NullBoolean to Boolean in https://github.com/mozilla/foundation.mozilla.org/commit/17a7d165e88accf1601a75ce4c070d73b40cbd56, so in the db these are currently Boolean fields that may be `None`.

title: Localize publication pages
body: We’ve hit a blocker with [the TikTok report](https://foundation.mozilla.org/campaigns/tiktok-political-ads/) being launched today. I need to publish a German translation of this publication page + all its article pages, and just realized the fields were not hooked for translation…

title: Fix the 404 page
body: The 404 page currently crashes the server by trying to load a template tag that doesn't exist. So instead of a 404, people get "SERVER ERROR 500" and that's super not useful.

title: publication articles cause a serer error 500 when previewing draft.
body:
STR:
- try to preview any of the child pages on https://foundation.mozilla.org/cms/pages/2126/
- you will see a Server Error 500
- the server log shows:
```
2021-05-27T18:09:06.414166+00:00 app[web.2]: Internal Server Error: /en/campaigns/tiktok-political-ads/references/

2021-05-27T18:09:06.414186+00:00 app[web.2]: KeyError: 0
```

So this might be a change in streamfield code in the new Wagtail that we forgot to take into account.

title: Investigate slow page load times on fo'mo
body:
### Details

Requests on fo'mo take upwards of 20 seconds, sometimes timing out when you're logged in to Wagtail (because Cloudflare caching is disabled when logged in). We need to investigate what is slowing Wagtail down and fix it

### Implementation Checklist

- [ ]  Investigate what is slowing down fo'mo using Papertrail, Scout, django debug toolbar, memory profiling tools e.g. Pympler, etc.
- [ ] Implement a fix
- [ ] (optional) look into ways to load test
- [ ] (optional) port any fixes applicable to donate over to donate.

**Pre-Merge**:
- [ ] Code follows our code style guide [documentation WIP]
- [ ] Code is documented according to our documentation standards [Need to create]
- [ ] Unit Test Coverage [need to create coverage target and tooling]
- [ ] Integration Test Coverage [need to create guide]
- [ ] Any technical debt is documented (todo/fixme => needs an issue linked in comments)
- [ ] Any follow-up tasks are created before a PR is merged
- [ ] Code peer-reviewed by at least one other developer

**If the work had design-dev handoff, also signed off by a designer**:
- [ ] Code has error handling with clear error messages
- [ ] Incomplete features are hidden behind feature flags (for features without Update or Delete DB migrations)
- [ ] Secrets (github actions + heroku) are up to date for CI, review apps, and staging

**Post-Merge, Pre-Production Deploy**:
- [ ] Code is deployed to Staging
- [ ] Code is manually verified to work on staging (rare, but important)
- [ ] Test management commands that may need to be run
- [ ] Release scripts are up to date (rare, but important)

**Production Deploy**:
- [ ] Production deploy successful
- [ ] Notify Stakeholders

title: Fix multiple root Collections
body:
When multiple Collections have a `depth=1` then none show up in the settings. 

And there's a wagtail 2.12 migration that looks for the root collection using `.get(depth=1)` but it returns more than one in our code base. We need to make sure there's only one. 

Luckily, it looks like the _other_ Collections that aren't `root` (`id=1`) are factory generated Collections. 

## Acceptance criteria
- [ ] Create a data migration to delete unused Collections with a depth of 1 (that aren't root, we _need_ the root collection for django-treebeard happiness)

title: Blog and Article Wide Iframe setting
body:
### Describe the bug
Blog and Article Pages don't have a "wide iframe" setting. This is less of a bug, and more of a woops we forgot a thing. This needs to be done before the general streamfield refactor we're planning on doing soon. 

Original spike ticket can be found here: #6672 

### Acceptence criteria:
#### Blog:
- [ ] Does not have a wide iframe setting. All iframes are "wide" by default. 

#### Article page:
- [ ] Does not have a wide iframe setting.

title: PNI: Clicking All category from a product page sends user back to same product page
body:
### Describe the bug
Clicking All category from a product page sends user back to same product page

### To Reproduce
1. Visit any product page
2. Click All in the sub-navigation

### Expected behavior
Should take user back to All Products (https://foundation.mozilla.org/en/privacynotincluded/)

### Screenshots
![image.png](https://images.zenhubusercontent.com/5fc93ac187345c0cf1d7ae58/671ff281-ac24-407f-9d8d-c95efad8cbea)

title: Small links are displaying side-by-side on article pages
body:
### Describe the bug
Issue relates to articles with sub-sections:
Links in the 2 column summary-link section are displaying on the same line if they are short in length

### To Reproduce
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to https://foundation.mozilla.org/en/data-futures-lab/data-for-empowerment/shifting-power-through-data-governance/ 
2. Note that "What is Data Collaborative" and "What is a data trust" fall on the same line


### Expected behavior
They should appear one after another

### Screenshots
If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/18314510/116596984-efd4c380-a8d9-11eb-9b07-c9973eba193e.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/18314510/116597006-f400e100-a8d9-11eb-874d-8847291759db.png)

title: PNI UI translations are broken

labels.name: buyer's guide 🛍
labels.description: Issues related to the buyer's guide

body:
Similarly to #6512, UI translations are missing and we need to add the `buyersguide` template directory to the `LOCALE_PATH` var.

This is happening because the `locale` folder is no longer at the root of a package listed in `INSTALLED_APPS`, so it needs to be explicitly added to `LOCALE_PATH`.

title: Server Error 500 on production (2021-04-28)
body:
### Describe the bug

We're seeing `server error 500` on production when using the CMS, but not consistently, and not even consistently for the same URLs/actions.

### To Reproduce

There are no reliable STR, I ran into this while trying to update group permissions in the CMS, where group edit URLs would error out every few reloads.

title: PNI search has broken
body:
Go to https://foundation.mozilla.org/en/privacynotincluded/, try to search

I'm seeing queryselector errors around a `btn-recommend`, which might be preventing the actual search code from having loaded.

Estimating as 1 based on the fact that we don't _actually_ know what's wrong yet.

title: Redirects don’t keep URL parameters
body:
URL parameters used to be kept during redirects, but it’s not the case anymore. This prevents us from generating performance reports on campaigns. Here’s an example below with a snippet campaign

### STR:
- Open https://foundation.mozilla.org/newsletter/?utm_source=desktop-snippet&utm_medium=snippet&utm_campaign=snipQ22021&utm_term=999999&utm_content=REL

### Current behavior:
Currently redirects me to: https://foundation.mozilla.org/fr/newsletter/

### Expected behavior:
Should be redirecting me to https://foundation.mozilla.org/fr/newsletter/?utm_source=desktop-snippet&utm_medium=snippet&utm_campaign=snipQ22021&utm_term=999999&utm_content=REL



This looks like a good candidate to add a test for as it’s not easy to notice it’s broken. Happy to file a separate ticket for this

title: utility.middleware.py breaks without TARGET_DOMAINS set
body:
The following code relies on TARGET_DOMAINS existing, which is not true when you're creating a new heroku app or pipeline
```
from django.http.response import HttpResponseRedirectBase
from django.conf import settings

hostnames = settings.TARGET_DOMAINS
referrer_value = 'same-origin'

if settings.REFERRER_HEADER_VALUE:
    referrer_value = settings.REFERRER_HEADER_VALUE

   ...
```

title: Translations of the PNI about section are broken
body:
#6442 was a hotfix in order to get the l10n system working again, but one part got missed and the translations of the PNI  about section are busted.
More details here: https://github.com/mozilla/foundation.mozilla.org/issues/6477#issuecomment-815106450

In addition to moving the translation files in the l10n repo, we also need to update the `LOCALE_PATH` variable, so that Django uses those files.

title: "ready-to-merge" label on approved PR doesn't do anything
body:
### Describe the bug
Setting "ready-to-merge" label on approved PR (that has passed all CI checks) doesn't do anything.

### Expected behavior
PR should be automatically merged.

title: PNI - "privacy not included" toggle box should be reset after refresh

labels.name: buyer's guide 🛍
labels.description: Issues related to the buyer's guide

body: ### Describe the bug Refreshing catalog-based pages (home, category pages) resets the filtered product list but doesn't reset the "privacy not included" checkbox. ### To Reproduce Steps to reproduce the behavio 1. Go to https://foundation.mozilla.org/en/privacynotincluded or any category page 2. Turn on the "*privacy not included" checkbox 3. Observe that product list is filtered 4. For comparison, keep this tab on and open another tab 5. In the new tab, follow step 1-3 and refresh the page 6. Notice that the product list is now unfiltered but the checkbox still stays on ### Expected behavior Checkbox should be reset to off after page refresh

title: Factory should generate a valid PDF for Publication Page for "Publication PDF" button
body:
STR:
1. Go to http://test.example.com:8000/en/publication-page-with-child-article-pages/
2. Hover over "Publication PDF"
3. Check file extension

title: Download button on Publication Page is off-brand
body: ### Describe the bug Download button on Publication Page is off-brand. I didn't check Article Page but the button there might be off-brand as well. ### To Reproduce Steps to reproduce the behavior: 1. Go to https://foundation.mozilla.org/en/insights/trustworthy-ai-whitepaper/ 2. Inspect the "Download PDF" button (default state and hover state) 3. Button is in a different style than what we have in the [style guide](https://foundation.mozilla.org/en/style-guide/) ### Expected behavior Button should follow style guide. Need to verify this with designers but I'm guessing the button should be in dark theme `.btn-primary` styling. e.g., we need to make sure on hover, the download icon is black instead of white. ### Screenshots Default state Hover state

title: Investigate mismatched HTML tag issues on article pages
body: ### Describe the bug There are HTML validation errors around mismatched HTML tags on our sample article pages. I'm guessing the cause might be some block template are missing opening/closing tags. ### To Reproduce Steps to reproduce the behavior: 1. Go to `/publication-page-with-chapter-pages/fixed-title-chapter-page/fixed-title-article-page/` locally or on review app. 2. View source code 3. Scroll through and look for highlighted mismatched HTML tag errors ### Expected behavior No mismatched HTML tags ### Screenshots

title: PNI category names are not translated anymore

labels.name: buyer's guide 🛍
labels.description: Issues related to the buyer's guide

body: I just noticed the PNI category names were not translated anymore, this is a regression that occurred sometime between the Valentine’s Day release and now. Glancing at recent commits, this looks like a solid candidate for this change https://github.com/mozilla/foundation.mozilla.org/pull/6317 Here’s the menu in French: When I try to edit https://foundation.mozilla.org/cms/snippets/wagtailpages/buyersguideproductcategory/11/ for instance, I’m getting an error message stating I don’t have permissions to access this area

title: [Publications] H2 Anchor Links Break with Bold/Italic Applied
body:
H2 links auto-generate anchor links in the summary box and drop down. When other styling such as bold and italic are also applied with H2 the link doesn't jump down to the section when clicked. 

This may be a bug as the links should still work. If we don't want people to use both as a practice we should make it more obvious as it isn't clear why sometimes H2s don't work.

title: Comment box should only appear if the box is check in the CMS
body:
Commento is showing up on all our blog posts. It should only show up if the check box is checked in the cms.

- [x] Comment box appears when the cms box is checked
- [x] Comment box is hidden if box is not checked (default)

Screen cap of the checkbox.

title: Highlight without an image will cause a templating crash
body:
Creating a highlight without an `image` set will crash the homepage. On local dev, this is a template crash, on prod, this will be a Server 500 error.

We don't currently have `required=True` set for Highlight images, so we should probably change that, as Highlights only exist as a way to feature (with graphics) a campaign on the homepage.

title: "What you can do" page: hero section
body: ### Describe the bug The current hero section of the What you Can do page has a duplicated image: one on top (like a banner) and one behind the copy. The screenshot below is from staging but issue is also happening on prod: ### To Reproduce Steps to reproduce the behavior: 1. Go to '[https://foundation.mozilla.org/en/what-you-can-do/](https://foundation.mozilla.org/en/what-you-can-do/)' 2. Use the "Responsive Design Mode" > iPhone 5 (or 6/7/8) 3. See bug ### Expected behavior When this page was built, the expected behavior was to have only the top banner. However, since we evolved the homepage to have a full width banner behind the copy on mobile, it makes more sense we replicate the same behavior for this page as the screenshot below for 2 reasons: 1. consistency and 2. to push the content up in the page ### Additional context @kristinashu @sabrinang @natalieworth: if you have any strong opinions/concerns in having this hero behaving the same as our homepage (as I am suggesting), please let's chat before engineers solve this bug. I'll tag it as only design for now so we can discuss it if needed. If you all agree, please give a thumbs up to this thread so I know we're all aligned. Thanks!

title: Total votes of PNI product should be based on `creepiness` votes, and not `confidence` votes
body:
### Describe the bug
Total votes of PNI product should be based on `creepiness` votes, and not `confidence` votes.

### To Reproduce
Steps to reproduce the behaviour:
1. Go to any product page on PNI
2. Scroll down to creep-o-meter section
3. Try voting without answering `How likely are you to buy it?` 
4. Submit vote and refresh the page
5. Scroll down to creep-o-meter section. Notice that "total votes" (labelled under the submit button) didn't increase.

title: unhardcode the `/blog` route

labels.name: purge
labels.description: Issues with this label will be purged from our backlog unless there is a very good reason.

body:
We rely on the blog posts always living on `/blog`, which means that if someone renames that (e.g. to `/news` or the like), everything that relies on the blog route for  streamfield etc. will break =(

Also note that renaming the `/blog` route means that every single link to blog posts in search engines will break, so while it'll be nice to fix this "bug", it's arguably more important to resist the temptation to change the route name. Unless we're somehow losing money by keeping it names "blog", we shouldn't be renaming that route.

On blog index page. (`/blog`) Author info is missing in the highlighted line. It should read `By [author] on Aug. 4, 2020` ### Case 2. On blog post page. It should read `By [author] | Aug. 4, 2020 | Advocacy`

title: PNI product factory does not guarantee even category distribution

labels.name: buyer's guide 🛍
labels.description: Issues related to the buyer's guide

body:
The PNI product factory currently assigns products to categories based on random distribution, which can cause one category to have 10 products and another category zero.

This should probably a round-robin assignment, assigning "whichever category has the fewest products in it" to a product (while retaining our logic for determining whether to assign a second, third, etc. category to a product).

This issue surfaced during the migration squashing, which revealed that it was possible for the category we use for percy testing to end up devoid of products, making for an incredibly bad test.

title: People Cards: invisible twitter icon
body: **Describe the bug** Twitter icon on people cards not seen until hover state. **To Reproduce** Steps to reproduce the behavior: 1. Go to: https://foundation.mozilla.org/en/fellowships/meet-our-fellows/ https://foundation.mozilla.org/en/fellowships/meet-team/ 2. Hover over area beside linked in icons. **Expected behavior** Should be present and black beside linkedin icon. **Screenshots** ![missing-twitter](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2492510/79398420-86378080-7f35-11ea-9da1-f1ac7e60bffe.gif) missing gap on mobile (ignore my screen tint): **Desktop (please complete the following information):** - OS: iOS 10.15.4 - Browser: Firefox 74.0.1 & Chrome 80.0.3987.163 **Smartphone (please complete the following information):** - Device: Pixel 2 - OS: android 10 - Browse: Firefox 68.7.0 & Chrome 81.0.4044.96

title: InvalidURL: URL can't contain control characters
body:
The pulse profile component throws this error when the ids entered have invalid characters. Is there a way we can filter them out or validate before/on save?

https://sentry.prod.mozaws.net/operations/foundation-mozilla-org/issues/7782994/

```
