title: Twitter icon on Pulse profile card should not be white
body: **Describe the bug** Twitter icon on Pulse profile card is in wrong color (should be black instead of white) which makes it looks invisible with the white card background. **To Reproduce** Go to https://foundation.mozilla.org/en/fellowships/meet-our-fellows/ **Screenshots** Hover state looks correct --- **If we haven't already, we should make sure these Pulse profile cards are shown up on Percy tests**

title: Copy link to clipboard icon is out of alignment
body:
**Describe the bug**
The copy link to clipboard icon is out of alignment compared with the rest of the icons near it.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to https://foundation.mozilla.org/en/blog/what-can-you-tell-me-about-zoom/
2. Look at the share icons
4. See error

**Expected behavior**
Icons are all aligned correctly

**Screenshots**
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/13520392/78460958-dc710d80-7671-11ea-95f9-2607023509bc.png)

**Desktop:**
 - OS: Windows 10
 - Browser: Chrome stable
 - Version: 80.0.3987.149

title: PNI: og image url is broken on prod and staging
body:
`og:image` url is invalid on prod and staging.

### Template code
```html
<meta property="og:image" content="{{request.scheme}}://{{request.get_host}}{% static "_images/buyers-guide/evergreen-social.jpg" %}">
```

### Source code from PNI prod
```html
<meta property="og:image" content="https://foundation.mozilla.orghttps://assets.mofoprod.net/static/_images/buyers-guide/evergreen-social.78437e17fd46.jpg">
```

### Source code from PNI staging
```html
<meta property="og:image" content="https://foundation.mofostaging.nethttps://assets.mofostaging.net/static/_images/buyers-guide/evergreen-social.78437e17fd46.jpg">
```

`https://foundation.mozilla.orghttps://assets.mofoprod.net/static/_images/buyers-guide/evergreen-social.78437e17fd46.jpg` is not a valid URL.

title: Language in the CMS changes

milestone.title: Icebox
milestone.description: Periodically revisited milestone for Issues that may either get moved to the backlog, or closed as not something we actually want/need anymore.

body:
**Describe the bug**
Updating the language on the site's footer also updates the language in the cms. However, @Pomax does not have this issue.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to https://foundation.mozilla.org/en/
2. Click on language dropped in the footer and select Deutsch, url is now https://foundation.mozilla.org/de/
3. In the url, replace `de` with `cms`
4. See error: CMS is now in Deutsh

**Expected behavior**
I'm not actually sure.

**Screenshots**
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1068783/76039442-4bd3d000-5f01-11ea-8de4-516384926691.png)


**Desktop:**
 - OS 10.15.3
 - Browser FF
 - Version 73.0.1

title: Language switcher doesn’t work in some cases

milestone.title: Icebox
milestone.description: Periodically revisited milestone for Issues that may either get moved to the backlog, or closed as not something we actually want/need anymore.

body:
There’s a specific case in which the language switcher stops working. It works a first time, but then when you land on a different locale again (e.g. you clicked on a hardcoded /en link), you can’t switch back.

Here are the STR:

- Set French as your preferred language for Web content (it would work with any locale we support)
- Open `foundation.mozilla.org/en` or any page in English
- Use the switcher to pick French
- You get redirected to /fr as expected.
- Now open `foundation.mozilla.org/en` again (or any page in English)
- Try to switch to French


→ You are not redirected

title: JS bundle contains eval()
body: The JS bundle now contains multiple `eval()`, probably added by the a11y build cc @Pomax @mmmavis

title: Newsletter signup form doesn't submit "country" information
body:
**Describe the bug**
Newsletter signup form doesn't submit "country" information 

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to any newsletter signup form on the site (e.g., footer)
2. Fill out everything in the form and submit
3. Open devtool and inspect
4. Country info is missing in the payload

**Expected behavior**
Country info should be included in payload

**Screenshots**
![image (2)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2896608/74558834-e3a05880-4f17-11ea-9796-b8c032a91e7c.png)

title: "Join-us" template causes an error in the React component when missing data-form-position
body:
Join us HTML that does not include a `data-form-position` (e.g. mozfest site footer) runs into a JS error when clicking on the email field, as it tries to resolve the `data-form-position` property, can't find it, and then tries to set a classList value on `undefined` rather than on a real element.

Note: we only just discovered this, but it's been broken for _a while_ now, apparently.

(see https://github.com/mozilla/foundation.mozilla.org/pull/4176#pullrequestreview-357044741)

title: GA Event stopped working for Opinion submitted in buyer's guide
body: **Describe the bug** Last year, we gathered stats on when users submitted an opinion about a product in the buyers guide. It seems like we lost the trigger on Nov 13th or 14th. **Expected behavior** These stats help us know whether our marketing and UX work is increasing or decreasing user engagement. **Screenshots** [Analytics here](https://analytics.google.com/analytics/web/#/report/content-event-events/a87658599w138395144p142716704/_u.date00=20190101&_u.date01=20200209&explorer-graphOptions.selected=analytics.nthMonth&_r.drilldown=analytics.eventCategory:Product,analytics.eventAction:Opinion%20Submitted&explorer-table.plotKeys=%5B%5D)

title: Newsletter page doesn't pass on tracking information to SFMC
body:
**Describe the bug**
When you try to sign up for the newsletter through https://foundation.mozilla.org/newsletter/, if you landed on it with a query string including utm codes (like https://foundation.mozilla.org/newsletter/?src=acqtestdec2019&utm_source=acqtestdec2019&utm_medium=cpc&utm_campaign=pro&utm_content=daily-kos), none of the querystring is passed on to Salesforce. We should pass this on so that we can properly report in SF.

Not sure if this is also the case with the footer newsletter signup, etc.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior (any browser):
1. Go to https://foundation.mozilla.org/en/newsletter/?utm_source=gideon&utm_medium=gideon&utm_campaign=gideon&utm_content=gideon and sign up for the newsletter.
2. Check your customer record's Signup Source URL in SF. It will only show https://foundation.mozilla.org/en/newsletter/ instead of the whole url.

**Expected behavior**
The entire landing page url should be recorded in SalesForce when signing up for the newsletter.

cc @stephaniemcv who can help with verifying + @WillatMozFdn who first discovered this with me.

title: Customize the order in which Pulse profiles show up in wagtail posts
body:
**Describe the bug**
The Pulse Profiles on the website don't follow the order entered in wagtail backend.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to ' backend of https://foundation.mozilla.org/en/internet-health-report/contributors/'
2. Enter numbers of Pulse profiles under "Contributors"
3. Publish
4. The profiles appear in their chronological order and not in the order from the backend

**Expected behavior**
I would like to be able to determine the order in which the profiles appear on our site but without having to list them one under another. 

Expected order for the editorial team on the site: Solana, Kasia, Jairus, Stefan (81,1518,1470,3281)

Thank you @Pomax

title: Investigate TooManyFieldsSent error for youtube campaign page.

milestone.title: Icebox
milestone.description: Periodically revisited milestone for Issues that may either get moved to the backlog, or closed as not something we actually want/need anymore.

body:
In order to fix https://github.com/mozilla/foundation.mozilla.org/issues/3798 "for now" we upped the Django field limit, without being absolutely certain that's actually the real problem we were facing.

We should revert that limit-change, and figure out why Django claims we're posting 1001+ fields when the document in question only has ~350 fields even when every single localised field has been assigned content.

title: signup_submission has issues
body:
Issue 1: Payload not verified

Steps to reproduce the behaviour:
1. `curl -X POST https://foundation.mozilla.org/api/campaign/signups/1/`

Generates a 500 internal server error because the payload is not checked: https://github.com/mozilla/foundation.mozilla.org/blob/1e460eb24f8d011941791f835e3d2b6cd3f0a19b/network-api/networkapi/campaign/views.py#L86-L93
 
Issue 2: CSRF token not required

Steps to reproduce the bahaviour:
1. `curl --request POST --header 'content-type: application/json' --data '{"email": "test@example.com","source": "Curl test"}' https://foundation.mozilla.org/api/campaign/signups/1/`

The post request succeeds, yet it should fail. we need to render the CSRF token in the form and subit it, as well as verify it in the view.

title: signup component does not show customized "description" text

The signup component seems to not set the `description` text for the signup if one was explicitly specified in the signup snippet UI in the CMS.

title: Fellowship directory - use flexbox instead of CSS grid
body: Upcoming directory related tickets: #2958 #3001 (It'd better if we tackle this ticket first.) --- There are quite a bit of arbitrary / magic numbers in `profiles.scss` ([existing code](https://github.com/mozilla/foundation.mozilla.org/blob/master/source/sass/wagtail/profiles.scss#L18-L29) & [in PR](https://github.com/mozilla/foundation.mozilla.org/pull/2997/files#diff-a7e457c11566b243d750e6a6acd87ad7)). It also seems like new sets of magic numbers have been added to the codebase every time we introduce minor design adjustment. This makes me wonder if CSS grid is the most suitable system to use here. From the [mockups](https://redpen.io/me6c690075cd81cd6f) it seems like design could most likely be easily implemented using flexbox without much mental math calculation involved. @Pomax @youriwims I don't know a lot about CSS grid so I'm curious if there's something specific about CSS grid that we wanna use and cannot be achieved using flexbox? Content in each card is different so forcing the same grid cell height and width across all cards doesn't seem like the right solution (e.g., let the `bio` section always take x% of the card's height). This results in unpredictable sizing & spacing for sections in each card. ### Few examples (screencap taken on production): 1. The two name sections have different width, height, and spacing to top border of the card. (**Expected: name section should have same width and spacing/margin across all cards.**) 2. The two social media sections have different width and height. (**Expected: dimension of this section should stay the same across all cards**)

title: Fellowships directory h6-heading bug
body: **Describe the bug** The h6-heading text switches between uppercase and lowercase. **To Reproduce** Steps to reproduce the behavior: 1. Go to https://foundation.mozilla.org/en/fellowships/meet-our-fellows/ and you will see h6 in lowercase (screen cap from PR) 2. Click on a different year and you will see h6 in uppercase (screen cap from PR) 3. Refresh the page, and h6 will go back to lowercase **Expected behavior** Case style should be consistent (I believe h6-heading should always be uppercase based on the [style guide](https://foundation.mozilla.org/en/style-guide/)). **Desktop (please complete the following information):** - OS: Mac OS 10.14.3 - Browser: FF - Version: 66.2

title: Increased space below Fellow name in Directory Component
body:
**Describe the bug**
It seems like some of the recent type updates may have altered the Fellows Directory. There's now `1rem` of `margin-bottom` below the Fellows' names whereas previously, it looks like there was ~half that.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to https://foundation.mozilla.org/en/fellowships/meet-our-fellows/

**Expected behavior**
There should be about 50% less spacing between the Fellow's name and their location.

>**Previous Version** (_please ignore the actual card spacing, that was documented in #2707 & fixed in #2832_)
![Screen Shot 2019-04-09 at 11 27 34 AM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/36484608/55813262-7da6a180-5aba-11e9-8167-7d6621864bf2.png)

title: 🌡 Bannered campaign page should have donation modal functionality

milestone.title: Icebox
milestone.description: Periodically revisited milestone for Issues that may either get moved to the backlog, or closed as not something we actually want/need anymore.

body:
**Describe the bug**
The BanneredCampaignPage should support donation modals just like the regular campaign page

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Sign a petition on a bannered campaign page
2. Observe there's no modal asking for a donation.
3. Observe there's no option to add that modal in the admin

**Expected behavior**
Visit a regular campaign page (like [this one](https://foundation.mozilla.org/cms/pages/315/edit/)) and notice that Donation Modal is a possible snippet, and it appears after signing the public petition.

title: Figure out how to make the nav "not need a scrollbar"

milestone.title: Icebox
milestone.description: Periodically revisited milestone for Issues that may either get moved to the backlog, or closed as not something we actually want/need anymore.

body:
From https://github.com/mozilla/foundation.mozilla.org/pull/2788#discussion_r264869974, 

>Two things to consider:
>
>1.) The DEV HELP item makes this worse at more resolutions than it is in reality
>2.) The fact that the nav needs to wrap in the first place seems like a bug, possibly a result of a switch to the items in the nav that we made a few months(?) ago.
>
>Between those two, I'd argue that this isn't an issue to solve here, and we should instead file a follow up about the banner itself looking wonky at just above 768px. Thoughts?

Let's find out how to fix our nav bar, because it should probably never trigger a scroll bar in the first place.

On the fellowships page, https://foundation.mozilla.org/en/fellowships/meet-our-fellows/, when you click into another cohort year and click on the name of the fellow the URL `https://www.mozillapulse.org/profile/{{ profile.profile_id }}` leads me to a _profile not found_

title: 🌡 URL encoding funkiness for buyer's guide

labels.name: buyer's guide 🛍
labels.description: Issues related to the buyer's guide

body:
I copied a URL from my browser and pasted it into Slack, only to discover it wasn't working:

https://foundation.mofostaging.net/en/privacynotincluded/categories/Valentine%E2%80%99s%20Day/

The correct link is 
https://foundation.mofostaging.net/en/privacynotincluded/categories/Valentine's%20Day/

The trick here is that somewhere along the way, the apostrophe got converted into a "smart apostrophe" (That's probably the wrong word. It's the curly kind.)

Given that this is going to start being shared narrowly tomorrow and broadly in the following few days, what's the best thing we can do to make sure we don't have users stumbling on this and getting 404's? Can we easily sanitize the string that generates the category URL to strip that character altogether (thus making the url `/categories/Valentines%20Day`)? Or should we simply catch it with a redirect in the CMS admin for now?

@patjouk @cadecairos @Pomax @mmmavis

title: Fake data generation fails without a homepage
body:
When I nuke my database and run a migration from scratch, then attempt to load fake data, it fails unless I've created a Homepage called 'Homepage'. 

`networkapi.wagtailpages.models.DoesNotExist: Homepage matching query does not exist.`

It seems like [this try block](https://github.com/mozilla/foundation.mozilla.org/blob/master/network-api/networkapi/management/commands/load_fake_data.py#L150-L152) isn't working properly.

title: Inconsistency between prod and local dev: bugs on deletes_data/child_rules

labels.name: buyer's guide 🛍
labels.description: Issues related to the buyer's guide

body:
/cc @cadecairos @alanmoo @kristinashu ### what's wrong? https://foundation.mofostaging.net/privacynotincluded/products/apple-watch-4/ shows off a bug in product page rendering, where its model looks like this: ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/177243/47396548-22395080-d6e0-11e8-940a-7bb76cf18e8a.png) but its associated product page looks like this: ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/177243/47396553-29605e80-d6e0-11e8-9f86-a2c111ba3dc6.png) Where React has created the following DOM (note the `criterion-undefined` entries): ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/177243/47396632-7b08e900-d6e0-11e8-8709-e1bf7b9827cf.png) Off of the following Django HTML: ```
``` ### trying this locally Copying the production database and loading it locally, I see the same model content: ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/177243/47396567-3715e400-d6e0-11e8-9e06-3fbc455049b3.png) But no errors on the associated product page: ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/177243/47396580-45fc9680-d6e0-11e8-8fe9-1d2ef471e08f.png) Because React generated this DOM: ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/177243/47396656-94aa3080-d6e0-11e8-9b9a-2478a63a5fb0.png) off of the following Django HTML: ```
``` So the same codebase, on the same database, on two different computers, yielding two very different HTML sources. I ... don't know how this is possible. (yet?)

title: Petition signees already subscribed to newsletter don't see share buttons
body:
STR:
1. Go to https://foundation.mozilla.org/en/campaigns/venmo-put-our-privacy-first/?subscribed=1
2. Sign the petition and click "no I'll share instead" in the modal.
3. You won't see the share buttons but will instead see the form as if an error occurred.

Pretty sure it's because we conditionally render the signup checkbox based on the `subscribed=1` query param out [here](https://github.com/mozilla/foundation.mozilla.org/blob/8ad24d5192a16a57857b53a4cc374cbfb6b7cc32/source/js/components/petition/petition.jsx#L634-L641). This makes [this ref](https://github.com/mozilla/foundation.mozilla.org/blob/master/source/js/components/petition/petition.jsx#L252) `undefined` which throws an error in the promise chain thus breaking it.

title: Opportunity/Campaign pages: heading inconsistencies
body:
Pulling this out of the bigger ticket from @sabrinang https://github.com/mozilla/foundation.mozilla.org/issues/1021 Heading styles on Opportunity/Campaign pages need to match the rest of the site. For example, h3 on these Opportunity/Campaign pages should be the same as h3 on the main site (i.e. be Zilla rather than Nunito). The spacing on Opportunity/Campaign also makes it hard to read and scan content. [Example: About page is great how there is a larger vertical space above the title than below (helps group the title with the content below)](https://foundation.mozilla.org/about) [Compared with the CMS pages where the spacing is the same and it takes more mental effort to group the content](https://foundation.mozilla.org/campaigns/aadhaar/aadhaar-challenges-and-the-path-forward/) Designers have been able to force some of the styles by editing in the Mezzanine code editor https://foundation.mofostaging.net/opportunity/cms-styles/ but it is very time consuming and the spacing is still off, forcing us to use lots of `

 

` cc @gvn @Pomax @alanmoo not too sure who would be able to work on this?

title: Opportunity pages > multi page-menu behaviour
body: I was wondering if we could fix a behaviour we are currently having in the multi-page menu, since this model of menu will also be used on the Fellowship Pages. The issue is that, once user select a category on the menu, the category doesn't stay visible Current behaviour (once I click "Video" I still see "Net Neutrality Groups"): ![current-behaviour](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22157921/35163036-35753256-fcfa-11e7-960a-0c41b0a4c4fe.gif) It was designed to have the category replaced on top once users click on that. ![desired-behaviour-opt1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22157921/35163107-7d1c8b22-fcfa-11e7-8988-8bdcdce0388f.gif) If this is too complicated to do, we could just have the word "menu" on top, always visible and as users select their option, it is still highlighted, but hidden under menu. @alanmoo @xmatthewx I assigned this ticket to you both to : 1. get your opinion on this issue (if you think there is another solution I am not seeing) and 2. triage this ticket

title: [LOCAL DEV] Opportunity pages with fake data on wrong path
body:
I'm not able to access any of the `/opportunity/<slug>` routes that were generated by the fake data factory. Instead, I am able to access them on `/<slug>`.

STR:
1. Follow all the instructions in the README
2. Login to the admin, click on Pages in the sidebar, and click on one of the pages. Scroll to the bottom and expand the Metadata section. Copy the URL.
3. Open `localhost:8000/opportunity/<url you copied>` in a browser. It should 404.
4. Go to `/<url you copied>`. It should show up.

title: 2018 news not showing on the `news` page
body: When you got to `https://foundation.mozilla.org/news/`, you can't see news from 2018 because there is no 2018 section.

title: Figure out why redirects aren't working
body: Redirects added at https://foundation.mozilla.org/admin/redirects/redirect/ aren't working (they 404). Let's figure out why.

title: Uploading Glyphs - "Latest from the Network" section (Home Page)
body: I am trying to upload some svg glyphs so we can have icons next to "Medium", for instance. When I try to do that via the admin page, I see a server error. Here is the gif: ![glyphs-issue-upload](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22157921/32868853-e7f9029a-ca28-11e7-897b-aab55e83300b.gif) Browser: Firefox Version: 57 (Quantum) @kristinashu @xmatthewx - this bug is related to the discussion we had in the stand-up today in which you requested to have those icons placed on the home page.

title: Using ENV variables in template means pipelines still don't quite work right.
body:
When we use pipeline promotion, the OG tags (as an example) on the homepage show the staging url, because we're using env variables in the pug file.

Is this a side effect of using XHR instead of Django templating to generate pages?

title: Unable to "npm start" a fresh clone of repo.
body:
I followed the instructions in the repo, and I'm getting an error when running ``npm start``.

I'm running...
* Node 6.8.1
* npm 3.10.8
* Python 2.7.10

cc @gvn @alanmoo 

---

Here's the relevant part of my ``npm-debug.log``

```
17 error Darwin 15.4.0
18 error argv "/usr/local/Cellar/node/6.8.1/bin/node" "/usr/local/bin/npm" "start"
19 error node v6.8.1
20 error npm  v3.10.8
21 error code ELIFECYCLE
22 error network@1.0.0 start: `npm i && npm run build-uncompressed && run-p server watch:**`
22 error Exit status 1
23 error Failed at the network@1.0.0 start script 'npm i && npm run build-uncompressed && run-p server watch:**'.
23 error Make sure you have the latest version of node.js and npm installed.
23 error If you do, this is most likely a problem with the network package,

23 error There is likely additional logging output above.
24 verbose exit [ 1, true ]
```

title: Latest from the Network section: persistent play button
body: Issue: in our "Latest from the Network" section the play button is persistent when we have no images in the featured item. There are 2 use cases where this button shouldn't be there: 1. When there is no image 2. When the featured news article isn't a video and the author uses an image to illustrate the featured item.

title: Missing glyphs should be null or empty string
body: If you look at https://network.mozilla.org/api/news/ you can see many glyphs with values of `https://assets.mofoprod.net/network/` which should either be empty strings or `null` because they are missing assets.

title: Opening the Menu is delayed in FF
body:
There is a long delay between clicking on the menu icon and the menu actually opening. It is quick in Chrome, Safari and mobile but slow on my FF. This is annoying because I then end up clicking the icon twice which eventually opens and then closes the menu right after. 

I am on FF 55.0.3 for mac OS 10.12.6. But although @taisdesouzalessa has the same version of FF, she does not have this problem...

title: Bug - Mini site: menu on top on mobile
body:
Bug happens on Firefox and Safari - iPhone 7
It is not a major usability issue since it works, I think this is a "nice to have" fix if we have the time.
cc: @xmatthewx 

The anchor for rotation of the arrow seems to be located on the right- it doesn't happen on a desktop browser, only on the phone.
![arrow](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22157921/30348642-f5252e26-97c4-11e7-8b74-47419f163ec1.gif)

title: Bug: Links to Anchors hidden under fixed nav
Limit Highlights that show on homepage to first 3
body:
It looks like the "Get Involved" section on the homepage will show everything that the API returns. We should either update the API to return 3 by default, support a `count` param and update the front-end to use that, or make the template only display the first 3.

@pomax @gvn thoughts? Maybe @arush0311 could implement?

title: CSP deprecated directive
body:
In Firefox:

`Content Security Policy: Directive ‘frame-src’ has been deprecated. Please use directive ‘child-src’ instead.`

title: Console errors in Chrome
body:
I'm seeing a couple of console errors in Chrome:

`Failed to set referrer policy: The value 'same-origin' is not one of 'no-referrer', 'no-referrer-when-downgrade', 'origin', 'origin-when-cross-origin', or 'unsafe-url'. The referrer policy has been left unchanged.`

`Error parsing header X-XSS-Protection: 1, mode=block: expected semicolon at character position 2. The default protections will be applied.`

I think this is because of some of the newly added HTTP response headers. @cadecairos any thoughts?

title: Images in custom pages should automatically be responsive
body: Because users can embed images in custom pages, these images should be [responsive](https://v4-alpha.getbootstrap.com/content/images/#responsive-images) by default. What this means is we need to add `height: auto` to all images in custom pages via CSS targeting. (I solved this temporarily on the fellows page by editing the source of the content but this isn't an appropriate long-term solution.)

title: Links in Join component do not work
body:
When attempting to add a link to the description of a signup component (https://network.mofoprod.net/admin/landingpage/signup/1/change/), there seems to be some issues with encoding of quotation marks that causes the string to only partially render (the link and everything after it disappear).

Since the component is being generated by a data attribute that react then uses, I believe the problem is in the front end code. Perhaps something needs to be done when passing the props to react.
